text: The difference in sensitivity affects very few cases, which suggests that the effect of the cytologic component of cotesting is very limited and that the effect on cancer incidence is unclear.56 Furthermore, over a longer follow-up period, the cumulative risks of $\mathrm { C I N } 2 +$ and $\mathrm { C I N } 3 +$ differ minimally between women with cotest-negative results and women with HPV-negative results.
